Item_Roast_31_Desc: A fully roasted chillshroom. It's evenly toasted and tastes a lot better than when eaten raw. Eating it will restore a bit of health.
Item_Roast_02_Desc: Raw bird drumstick that's been cooked to a crisp, skin and all. It's devoid of seasoning, but it has a simple, accessible taste. Restores more hearts than the raw variety.
Item_PlantGet_E_Desc: This medicinal plant grows in high elevations, such as mountains in the Hebra or Gerudo regions. When cooked into a dish, it will temporarily increase your heat resistance.
PutRupee_Silver_Desc: 100 rupees. Its dazzling silver light reflects your beaming smile.
Item_Boiled_01_Desc: A bird egg boiled using water from naturally occurring hot springs. It's popular among children and is easy to make.
Item_FishGet_F_PictureBook: This ocean-dwelling fish comes with one rude attitude. The compounds in its flesh elevate your competitive spirit when it's cooked into a dish, thus increasing your attack power.
Item_PlantGet_Q_Desc: Highly valued as a medicinal plant, this carrot contains large amounts of nourishing energy. When cooked into a dish, it boosts your stamina beyond its maximum limit.
Item_Enemy_20_Desc: This can only be obtained from an Octorok- type enemy. It's too acidic for cooking, but it's highly valued as an ingredient for elixirs.
Item_RoastFish_07_Desc: Roasting this freshwater carp helped to suppress some of its stench, making it easier to stomach. You can really sink your teeth into the thick, meaty flesh.
Item_FishGet_E_PictureBook: This freshwater fish lives alongside its less mighty carp ilk. A compound in its liver promotes muscle growth. Dishes cooked with it will temporarily increase your attack power.
Item_InsectGet_K_PictureBook: This crab is well known for its exceptionally sharp pincers. When cooked, the strength compound in its claws will increase your attack power.
Item_Ore_G_Desc: This mysterious mineral gives off a pale blue glow in the dark, which some believe to be souls of the dead. Apparently, this stone can be used as a base to make special clothing.
Item_Meat_02_Desc: A fresh, high-quality piece of animal meat. This stuff isn't easy to come by, so savor it. Cook it to recover more hearts.
Item_Chilled_01_Desc: A frozen slab of animal meat. If you can manage to chew it up and swallow it, you'll restore some hearts and lower your body temperature.
Item_Fruit_G_PictureBook: Fruit from palm trees that grow near the ocean. It doesn't offer any special effects but will increase your heart recovery when used as an ingredient.
Item_Fruit_B_Desc: A fruit that grows in cold, snowy regions known for its tangy, sweet flavor. It doesn't offer any special effects, but it's a popular cooking ingredient.
Item_FishGet_B_Desc: This large fish lives near the shoreline. Its sizable body can store a lot of nutrients. When cooked into a dish, it will temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_Enemy_18_Desc: The wing of a Keese. It's covered with very short, sharp fur. It's not much use by itself, but you can mix it with critters to make something useful.
Item_Roast_28_Desc: Simple, roasted armoranth. The heat has frayed the hard, chewy fiber just enough to make it easy to eat.
Item_Fruit_F_PictureBook: This resilient fruit can flourish even in the heat of the desert. The hydrating liquid inside provides a cooling effect that, when cooked, increases your heat resistance.
Item_Material_05_00_Desc: This fresh milk comes from Hateno cows and white goats kept in the village. It's delicious on its own but can also be used as an ingredient in soups and stews.
Item_Mushroom_N_00_Desc: Years of going unpicked have allowed this hearty truffle to grow quite large. It's chock- full of nutrients. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
Item_Fruit_E_PictureBook: The plant that bears these seeds grows near deep water. The roots draw nutrients from the water, which boosts your movement speed when the seeds are cooked into a dish.
Item_FishGet_Z_Desc: This wild armored carp has been bred into a prizewinning fish. Its beautifully colored markings do not occur in nature. It offers no special effects when cooked.
Item_Enemy_46_Desc: A rare Ice Keese wing. Its frozen surface gleams attractively, but its usefulness isn't readily apparent.
Obj_AncientArrow_C_01_PictureBook: A bundle of three ancient arrows. Daggers created using ancient technology have been repurposed for use as arrows. Extremely effective against Guardians.
Item_Mushroom_A_Desc: A green mushroom that grows near trees in the forest. It's chock-full of natural energy. Cook it to release its stamina-restoration properties.
Item_PlantGet_C_Desc: This hearty radish has grown much larger than the average radish. It's rich in analeptic compounds that, when cooked into a dish, temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_Enemy_03_Desc: This winding horn once grew atop the head of a Lizalfos. It's too hard to use for cooking, but stores are willing to buy it from you. It can also be used to make elixirs.
Item_Enemy_32_Desc: A nail obtained from a Hinox. It's as thick as a plate of armor and can be stewed with critters to make elixirs.
Obj_IceArrow_A_03_PictureBook: A bundle of five ice arrows. Ice arrows break apart on impact, freezing objects in the immediate area. Incredibly effective against hot things.
Item_Mushroom_M_Desc: The cap of this mushroom is very hard. Use it when cooking to prepare a dish that increases your defense.
Item_Ore_A_00_Desc: The most precious gem one can find in Hyrule, its signature sparkle has charmed Hyruleans for generations. As such, it has sold for a very high price since ancient times.
Item_PlantGet_O_Desc: This vitality-rich flower blooms mainly on cliffsides. When cooked into a dish, the nourishing compounds increase your movement speed.
Item_PlantGet_O_PictureBook: This vitality-rich flower blooms mainly on cliffsides. When cooked into a dish, the nourishing compounds increase your movement speed.
Obj_Photo_Other_Desc: A picture of an exciting subject, such as a  treasure chest or ore.
Item_FishGet_Z_PictureBook: This wild armored carp has been bred into a prizewinning fish. Its beautifully colored markings do not occur in nature. It offers no special effects when cooked.
Item_Ore_E_Desc: A valuable ore that gives off a mesmerizing iridescence similar to the inside of a seashell. It contains the power of water.
Obj_IceArrow_A_03_Desc: A bundle of five ice arrows. Ice arrows break apart on impact, freezing objects in the immediate area. Incredibly effective against hot things.
Item_RoastFish_04_Desc: A fresh hearty salmon roasted simply over an open flame without any additional flavoring. Not only is the skin edible, but it gives off a rather nice aroma as well.
Item_Enemy_29_Desc: A machine part used in ancient machinery. It's incredibly sturdy, and it's not made of any recognizable material. It may come in handy someday.
Obj_BombArrow_A_04_Desc: A bundle of 20 bomb arrows. The explosive powder packed into the tips of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item_Mushroom_N_PictureBook: Years of going unpicked have allowed this hearty truffle to grow quite large. It's chock- full of nutrients. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
Item_Enemy_15_Desc: A jiggly substance that normally comes from a Fire Chuchu. It consistently gives off heat. If struck, it will explode in a ball of flame.
Item_Mushroom_M_PictureBook: The cap of this mushroom is very hard. Use it when cooking to prepare a dish that increases your defense.
Item_Fruit_K_Desc: Often found on the ground near trees. Squirrels adore this nut, so you may have competition while foraging. Add one to a meal for a nutty seasoning.
Item_FishGet_K_Desc: This snail lives on sandy beaches in large numbers. Its flesh contains a high amount of stimulants, so when cooked into a dish, it temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
Item_Material_08_Desc: A result of Kilton's research into monsters, this suspicious spice can be used to punch up dishes while cooking. Apparently it can be used to make a number of monstrous meals.
Obj_DLC_HeroSeal_Rito_Desc: The commemorative symbol of a wind trial's completion by one who wishes to control a Divine Beast. Collecting three emblems will lead to a new challenge.
Item_Roast_11_Desc: These mighty bananas have been roasted whole. Cooking them through has turned the fruit inside into a sticky, rich, aromatic syrup.
Item_Roast_40_Desc: Raw prime meat cooked over an open flame. The outside is perfectly browned, while the inside is mouthwateringly juicy.
Item_Enemy_43_Desc: The severed tail of an Electric Lizalfos. Its powerful stench makes it unappetizing and unfit for cooking, but it's highly valued as an ingredient for elixirs.
Obj_HeroSoul_Rito_Desc: A blusterous power born from the spirit of the Champion Revali. Creates an upward draft that carries you into the sky. Activate by charging jump with .
Item_Enemy_00_Desc: The severed horn of a Bokoblin, a creature often encountered on the plains of Hyrule. It isn't edible, but it can be tossed into a stew with some critters to make an elixir.
Item_Mushroom_J_Desc: A strange mushroom that glows softly in the forest at night. Cooking it into a dish unlocks the nutrients in its cap, resulting in a meal that will allow you to move stealthily.
Item_Roast_09_Desc: This hearty durian was roasted whole inside its hard shell. Unfortunately, roasting it did nothing to remove its distinct odor. Eat it to recover a lot of hearts.
Item_PlantGet_L_Desc: This medicinal plant grows abundantly in the Gerudo Desert. Its peculiar fibers conduct electricity, which will increase your electricity resistance when cooked into a dish.
Item_PlantGet_I_PictureBook: A plant that grows in quieter areas of Hyrule. At night, it gives off a soft glow. Cook with it to increase your stealth.
Item_Meat_11_Desc: This prized cut of meat is usually from a large animal. Any connoisseur would rank this tender, juicy cut of meat "gourmet." Expect an exquisite meal when cooking with this.
Obj_BombArrow_A_02_PictureBook: A bundle of five bomb arrows. The explosive powder packed into the tips of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item_InsectGet_Z_Desc: This crab appears in large numbers when it rains. One bite of its delectable meat, and you'll forget all your exhaustion. Replenishes your stamina when cooked into a dish.
Item_InsectGet_Z_PictureBook: This crab appears in large numbers when it rains. One bite of its delectable meat, and you'll forget all your exhaustion. Replenishes your stamina when cooked into a dish.
Item_Ore_B_Desc: A precious red gem mined from large ore deposits found throughout Hyrule. Rubies contain the power of fire and have fetched a high price since ancient times.
Item_PlantGet_H_PictureBook: This tough medicinal plant cannot be broken, but it can be cooked. Its durable yet flexible fibers raise your defense when cooked into a dish.
Obj_FireArrow_A_02_PictureBook: A bundle of 10 fire arrows. Fire arrows break apart on impact, igniting objects in the immediate area. Incredibly effective against cold things.
Obj_ProofBook_Desc: Inside the envelope is a picture of a beautiful young woman of the Sheikah tribe.
Item_Roast_37_Desc: A razorshroom that's been exposed to direct heat. Its sharp exterior has softened considerably. Restores a bit of health.
Obj_Photo_Animal_Desc: A picture of an animal, bird, fish, or insect.
Item_RoastFish_01_Desc: A bass that's been cooked whole over an open flame. It's flaky and savory smelling. Offers more hearts than the raw version.
Item_Enemy_55_Desc: This shard fell from the golden spirit Farosh's fang. It's so hard, hammers bounce right off it, so it's impossible to process. Yet rumors say it does have some use as a material.
Item_Material_06_Desc: Butter made from the milk of a domesticated white goat. In addition to being used in dishes like stews and meunière, it's often used when making cakes and other sweets.
Item_Enemy_41_Desc: The severed tail of a Fire-Breath Lizalfos. Its flavor makes the flesh inedible, but toss it into a stew with some critters, and you'll have yourself a nice elixir.
Item_Enemy_12_Desc: The Lynel this horn once grew upon surely misses it. It's exceptionally hard—so hard that most blades cannot scratch it. Throw it into a stew with critters to make elixirs.
Item_Roast_51_Desc: Roasting a bird egg whole in its shell like this helps retain water, making the egg a bit chewier than usual.
Item_Fruit_H_Desc: This fruit grows mainly in tropical forests of the Faron region. When it's used as an ingredient, the resulting dish will temporarily increase your attack power.
Item_FishGet_H_Desc: Calcium deposits in the scales of this ancient fish make them as hard as armor. Cooking it into a dish will fortify your bones, temporarily increasing your defense.
Item_Mushroom_F_PictureBook: This rare mushroom has a rich scent. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_ChilledFish_05_Desc: This frozen porgy is the ideal snack for hiking through hot climates like the Gerudo Desert. Eating it provides a temporary boost to your heat resistance.
Item_Roast_49_Desc: This big hearty truffle has been roasted whole. It gets full points for aroma and nutrition. Eat it to recover a lot of hearts.
Obj_ProofSandwormKiller_Desc: A medal presented by Kilton in somber honor of having defeated every Molduga. Slaying a monster is a heavy burden to bear. You must steel yourself to carry that weight.
Item_Roast_06_Desc: A Hylian shroom toasted to perfection. The taste and fragrance are amplified, restoring more health to its consumer.
Item_RoastFish_13_Desc: Sneaky river snail roasted whole in its shell. The meat is soft and a little chewy. Pulling all the meat from the shell in one go fills you with a sense of accomplishment.
Item_InsectGet_K_Desc: This crab is well known for its exceptionally sharp pincers. When cooked, the strength compound in its claws will increase your attack power.
Item_PlantGet_C_PictureBook: This hearty radish has grown much larger than the average radish. It's rich in analeptic compounds that, when cooked into a dish, temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_PlantGet_I_Desc: A plant that grows in quieter areas of Hyrule. At night, it gives off a soft glow. Cook with it to increase your stealth.
Item_Enemy_38_Desc: This precious scale fell from the red spirit Dinraal. It emanates a great heat. You can use it in cooking, but just eating it seems like a waste.
Obj_ArrowBundle_A_01_Desc: A bundle of five common arrows. The shafts of these arrows were carved from the wood of a sturdy tree.
Item_PlantGet_B_PictureBook: A rare radish that grows best in sunny plains. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_Enemy_24_Desc: A sturdy fin obtained from a Molduga. It can be used to make elixirs, but there may be someone willing to trade for it.
Item_PlantGet_A_PictureBook: This healthy herb grows abundantly in the plains of Hyrule. Cook it before eating to increase the number of hearts it restores.
Item_Chilled_05_Desc: High-quality, frozen bird meat. It's so solid it looks like it could be used as a weapon. Eating it will restore some hearts and cool you down, but don't break your teeth on it.
Item_Fruit_F_Desc: This resilient fruit can flourish even in the heat of the desert. The hydrating liquid inside provides a cooling effect that, when cooked, increases your heat resistance.
Item_FishGet_F_Desc: This ocean-dwelling fish comes with one rude attitude. The compounds in its flesh elevate your competitive spirit when it's cooked into a dish, thus increasing your attack power.
Item_Enemy_52_Desc: This shard chipped and fell off the blue spirit Naydra. It's said the horn is the crystallized power of ice itself. It sells for quite a bit, but rumors say it has some other use.
Item_Material_03_Desc: This grain is a favorite among residents of Kakariko Village. It's grown in regions with a lot of water and is quite versatile. Used as an ingredient in things like risotto and rice balls.
Obj_ElectricArrow_A_03_Desc: A bundle of five shock arrows. Shock arrows break apart on impact, channeling electricity into nearby objects. Very effective against metals and moisture.
Obj_StaminaUtuwa_A_01_Desc: The size of your Stamina Wheel has been increased, allowing you to perform more actions before getting tired.
Obj_DLC_HeroSeal_Gerudo_Desc: The commemorative symbol of a lightning trial's completion by one who wishes to control a Divine Beast. Collecting three emblems will lead to a new challenge.
Item_Mushroom_A_PictureBook: A green mushroom that grows near trees in the forest. It's chock-full of natural energy. Cook it to release its stamina-restoration properties.
Obj_HeroSoul_Gerudo_Desc: A destructive power born from the unbridled anger of the Champion Urbosa. Summons powerful lightning to the surrounding area. Trigger with a charge attack by holding .
Item_ChilledFish_02_Desc: This salmon doesn't taste quite as fishy because the excess fat has been removed. It's exceptionally cold, so eating it provides a temporary boost to heat resistance.
Item_Enemy_07_Desc: A sharp fang obtained from a Moblin. It's too hard to be reshaped into a tool, but it can be tossed into a stew with some critters to create elixirs.
Item_MushroomGet_D_Desc: A mushroom that can grow almost anywhere but prefers ceilings and sheer cliffs. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your movement speed.
Item_Roast_46_Desc: This raw whole bird has been tickled by an open flame to bring out its flavor. Less is more, as the lack of additional seasoning allows its natural taste to shine.
Obj_ArrowBundle_A_02_PictureBook: A bundle of 10 common arrows. The shafts of these arrows were carved from the wood of a sturdy tree.
Item_Roast_32_Desc: It's always a good idea to keep a fully roasted sunshroom or two on hand just in case. Eat it to recover a bit of health.
Item_Roast_03_Desc: Direct heat has softened and sweetened this apple. Eat it to restore three quarters of a heart.
Item_PlantGet_F_Desc: This medicinal plant grows in hot regions, such as the Gerudo Desert. It's warm to the touch and increases your cold resistance when cooked into a dish.
Obj_ArrowBundle_A_01_PictureBook: A bundle of five common arrows. The shafts of these arrows were carved from the wood of a sturdy tree.
Obj_BombArrow_A_10_Desc: A powerful arrow designed to destroy monsters. The explosive powder packed into the tip ignites on impact, dealing massive damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item_FishGet_H_PictureBook: Calcium deposits in the scales of this ancient fish make them as hard as armor. Cooking it into a dish will fortify your bones, temporarily increasing your defense.
Item_Enemy_21_Desc: This can only be obtained from an Octorok- type enemy. You can sell it to a store, or you can make elixirs with it, but it may have other uses, as well.
Item_Enemy_50_Desc: This valuable claw was plucked from the blue spirit Naydra. It was freezing cold before it was removed. You could sell it, but there must be some other use for it.
Item_FishGet_G_PictureBook: This porgy's body is covered in armor-hard scales. The compounds in its scales, when cooked into a dish, fortify your bones and temporarily boost your defense.
Item_Ore_H_Desc: Crystallized salt from the ancient sea commonly used to season meals.  Cannot be eaten in this form.
Item_Chilled_02_Desc: High-quality, frozen animal meat. Doesn't restore many hearts, but it can lower your body temperature.
Item_Fruit_I_PictureBook: This pepper is exploding with spice. Cook with it to create dishes that will raise your body temperature and help you withstand the cold.
Item_Fruit_C_Desc: Cacti found in the Gerudo Desert bear this sweet fruit. It's naturally insulated, so when cooked into a dish, it provides resistance against electricity.
Item_FishGet_C_Desc: This blue trout prefers cold bodies of water. Its skin contains enzymes that keep its body cool, and when cooked into a dish, it will temporarily boost your heat resistance.
Obj_AncientArrow_B_01_Desc: A bundle of five ancient arrows. Daggers created using ancient technology have been repurposed for use as arrows. Extremely effective against Guardians.
Obj_Photo_Weapon_Desc: A picture of a battle-tested weapon, such as a sword, spear, or bow.
Item_Fruit_H_PictureBook: This fruit grows mainly in tropical forests of the Faron region. When it's used as an ingredient, the resulting dish will temporarily increase your attack power.
Item_Roast_15_Desc: This fortified pumpkin has been roasted whole. The hard rind serves as a container for the steamed pumpkin flesh inside.
Item_Enemy_47_Desc: This shard fell from the red spirit Dinraal's fang. It's exceptionally hard and therefore impossible to process, but apparently it can be used as a material for something.
Obj_ArrowBundle_A_10_Desc: A common arrow. Its shaft was carved from the wood of a sturdy tree.
Item_Mushroom_B_Desc: Often found at the base of pine trees in cold climates, these mushrooms are cool to the touch and can be used to cook dishes that allow you to stay cool even in arid regions.
Item_Enemy_04_Desc: This talon once grew from the elbow of a Lizalfos. You can stew it with critters to make elixirs, but it may have some other uses, as well.
Item_Enemy_33_Desc: A tooth obtained from a Hinox. It's so large, it's hard to believe it's a real tooth. It can be used to make elixirs.
Item_Mushroom_N_Desc: Years of going unpicked have allowed this hearty truffle to grow quite large. It's chock- full of nutrients. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
Item_PlantGet_Q_PictureBook: Highly valued as a medicinal plant, this carrot contains large amounts of nourishing energy. When cooked into a dish, it boosts your stamina beyond its maximum limit.
Obj_KorokNuts_Desc: This small seed was given to you by a Korok. It has a distinct smell. If you gather a bunch of them, you never know what may happen...
Item_Ore_F_Desc: A fossilized resin with a caramelesque sheen to it. It's been valued as a component in decorations and crafting since ancient times.
Obj_Armor_115_Head_Desc: A precious Gerudo heirloom reclaimed from the Yiga. It has the power to withstand Naboris's lightning. Guard it with your life until you can return it to Riju.
Item_FishGet_B_PictureBook: This large fish lives near the shoreline. Its sizable body can store a lot of nutrients. When cooked into a dish, it will temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_FishGet_A_PictureBook: An ordinary fish that can be found all over Hyrule. It can be eaten raw, but cooking it amplifies its healing benefits.
Item_Enemy_16_Desc: A jiggly substance that came from an Electric Chuchu. Electricity pulses through its gelatinous mass. If struck, it will explode in a burst of electric current.
Item_Mushroom_O_PictureBook: A rare yellowish-orange mushroom. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your stamina limit.
Item_Fruit_B_PictureBook: A fruit that grows in cold, snowy regions known for its tangy, sweet flavor. It doesn't offer any special effects, but it's a popular cooking ingredient.
Item_Fruit_L_Desc: Small birds love this nut. You can eat it raw for a minor effect, but it can also be added as a spice to other recipes.
Item_FishGet_L_Desc: This Hyrule bass got to be the biggest fish by never getting caught (until now). Its long life results in a cooked dish that will restore a lot of stamina.
PutRupee_Red_Desc: 20 rupees. Its red luster tickles your heartstrings.
Item_Roast_12_Desc: This hydromelon was roasted whole for a very soft and flaky inner flesh with a rather intriguing flavor. Now this is your money melon!
Item_Roast_41_Desc: Prime meat that's been flame-seared to perfection. The outside is crispy, but the inside is juicy. Eat it to recover hearts.
Item_Fruit_A_PictureBook: A common fruit found on trees all around Hyrule. Eat it fresh, or cook it to increase its effect.
Item_FishGet_X_Desc: Consuming the bioluminescent compound that makes this fish glow in the dark will increase concentration. Dishes cooked with it will suppress noise when consumed.
Item_Enemy_44_Desc: A rare Fire Keese wing. There isn't enough Fire Keese attached to it to burn you, but it does have a slight warmth to it. It can be used as an ingredient for elixirs.
Item_PlantGet_A_Desc: This healthy herb grows abundantly in the plains of Hyrule. Cook it before eating to increase the number of hearts it restores.
Item_Enemy_01_Desc: A tooth obtained from a Bokoblin. It's worn down and not very sharp, but it's still pretty hard. Cook it alongside a critter to make an elixir.
Item_Enemy_30_Desc: This crystal was made using lost technology. At one time it was the power source for ancient machines. This item is very valuable to researchers.
Item_ChilledFish_08_Desc: The distinct glow of this sneaky river snail has diminished after it's been frozen, but eating it like this will provide a temporary increase to your heat resistance.
Item_InsectGet_O_Desc: This crab's shell is particularly hard. When cooked into a dish, its fat and meat bolster the body to increase your defense.
Item_PlantGet_M_Desc: This carrot is cultivated extensively in Kakariko Village. It strengthens the legs and hips when cooked into a dish, which helps increase your movement speed.
Obj_ArrowBundle_A_10_PictureBook: A common arrow. Its shaft was carved from the wood of a sturdy tree.
Obj_BombArrow_A_04_PictureBook: A bundle of 20 bomb arrows. The explosive powder packed into the tips of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item_Ore_C_Desc: A precious blue gem mined from natural rock formations. Sapphires contain the very essence of ice. They've been known to fetch a high price since ancient times.
Item_PlantGet_J_PictureBook: This lovely flower was said to have been a favorite of the princess of Hyrule. Once feared to have gone extinct, it's recently been spotted growing in the wild.
Obj_BombArrow_A_03_PictureBook: A bundle of 10 bomb arrows. The explosive powder packed into the tips of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Obj_AncientArrow_B_01_PictureBook: A bundle of five ancient arrows. Daggers created using ancient technology have been repurposed for use as arrows. Extremely effective against Guardians.
Item_Roast_38_Desc: An ironshroom exposed to an open flame. Its once-tough exterior is now crunchy and tasty. Restores a bit of health.
PutRupee_Gold_Desc: 300 rupees! Its radiant golden shine illuminates your soul.
Obj_FireArrow_A_03_PictureBook: A bundle of five fire arrows. Fire arrows break apart on impact, igniting objects in the immediate area. Incredibly effective against cold things.
Item_Roast_24_Desc: A fragrant swift carrot that's been lightly roasted. It doesn't have any special effects, but it will restore some health.
Item_RoastFish_02_Desc: An open flame has crisped the skin of this hearty bass to perfection. It's a sizable portion and contains just the right amount of fat to create an exceptionally tasty dish.
Item_Enemy_27_Desc: A screw used in ancient machinery. It's made of an unknown material, and no matter how many times it's turned, its threads never seem to show signs of wear.
Item_Enemy_56_Desc: This shard fell off the golden spirit Farosh. It's said the horn is the crystallized power of electricity itself. It sells for a lot, but there must be some other use for it.
Item_Material_07_Desc: This grain is cultivated extensively on the Tabantha Plains. It's ground finely with a millstone to be used in cooking. Use it to make things such as stews and breads.
Obj_BombArrow_A_02_Desc: A bundle of five bomb arrows. The explosive powder packed into the tips of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item_Enemy_42_Desc: The severed tail of an Ice-Breath Lizalfos. Its hard scales and flesh make it unsuitable for cooking, but it's perfect for making elixirs.
Item_Enemy_13_Desc: This rare ingredient can be obtained only from a Lynel's foot. It's larger and heavier than a horse's hoof. It's useful for making elixirs but may have uses beyond that.
KeySmall_Desc: A key that can unlock doors inside shrines.
Item_Roast_52_Desc: A tree seed roasted to amplify its fragrance. Gives more hearts than the raw variety.
Item_Fruit_I_Desc: This pepper is exploding with spice. Cook with it to create dishes that will raise your body temperature and help you withstand the cold.
Item_FishGet_I_Desc: This fish makes its home in cold water, giving it extra layers of fat. It temporarily increases your maximum hearts when used in cooking.
Obj_DLC_HeroSeal_Goron_Desc: The commemorative symbol of a fire trial's completion by one who wishes to control a Divine Beast. Collecting three emblems will lead to a new challenge.
Item_Mushroom_H_PictureBook: This mushroom grows wild in the Gerudo region. The cap is naturally insulated, so when used in cooking, it will offer protection against electricity.
Item_ChilledFish_06_Desc: This hearty bass has been frozen by cold air. Eating it will be a challenge because it's frozen solid, but if you persevere, it will temporarily increase your heat resistance.
Obj_DLC_HeroSoul_Zora_Desc: Champion Mipha's divine gift. If your hearts run out, you'll automatically be resurrected with full health plus temporary bonus hearts. It now requires less time to recharge.
Item_Mushroom_H_Desc: This mushroom grows wild in the Gerudo region. The cap is naturally insulated, so when used in cooking, it will offer protection against electricity.
Item_Roast_07_Desc: This wildberry was prepared over an open flame to alter its sweet taste. It recovers more health than if eaten raw.
Item_PlantGet_E_PictureBook: This medicinal plant grows in high elevations, such as mountains in the Hebra or Gerudo regions. When cooked into a dish, it will temporarily increase your heat resistance.
Item_PlantGet_J_Desc: This lovely flower was said to have been a favorite of the princess of Hyrule. Once feared to have gone extinct, it's recently been spotted growing in the wild.
Item_Enemy_39_Desc: This valuable claw was plucked from the red spirit Dinraal. It was extremely hot before it was removed. You could sell it to a store, but it must have some other use.
Obj_ArrowBundle_A_02_Desc: A bundle of 10 common arrows. The shafts of these arrows were carved from the wood of a sturdy tree.
Item_Enemy_25_Desc: A giant organ obtained from a Molduga. This invaluable ingredient is hard to come by, and its use is shrouded in mystery.
Obj_AncientArrow_C_01_Desc: A bundle of three ancient arrows. Daggers created using ancient technology have been repurposed for use as arrows. Extremely effective against Guardians.
Item_MushroomGet_D_PictureBook: A mushroom that can grow almost anywhere but prefers ceilings and sheer cliffs. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your movement speed.
Obj_WarpDLC_Desc: This mysterious tool was made using forgotten ancient technology. Place it by opening your pouch and registering your current location as a travel gate.
Item_Chilled_06_Desc: This raw whole bird may have been frozen solid, but its flavor remains intact. Eating it will provide a temporary boost to your heat resistance.
Item_Fruit_G_Desc: Fruit from palm trees that grow near the ocean. It doesn't offer any special effects but will increase your heart recovery when used as an ingredient.
Item_FishGet_G_Desc: This porgy's body is covered in armor-hard scales. The compounds in its scales, when cooked into a dish, fortify your bones and temporarily boost your defense.
Item_Enemy_53_Desc: This precious scale fell from the golden spirit Farosh. It contains powerful electricity within. You can cook with it, but just eating it seems like a waste.
Item_Material_04_Desc: A fresh bird egg necessary for making dishes such as omelets and crepes. You can snag them from birds' nests if you're sneaky. Nutritious and delicious, perfect for cooking.
Item_Meat_06_Desc: This meat is tougher and chewier than a standard steak. Tastes better cooked.
Obj_Photo_Enemy_Desc: A picture of one of the various monsters that can be found throughout Hyrule.
Obj_HeartUtuwa_A_01_Desc: Your life force has been strengthened, increasing your maximum number of hearts by one.
Item_Mushroom_C_PictureBook: A bright red mushroom that grows in hot climates. Imbued with the power of heat,  they can be used to cook dishes that will allow you endure the bitter cold.
Obj_ProofGolemKiller_Desc: A medal presented by Kilton in somber honor of having defeated every Stone Talus. Taking the life of a monster is a solemn act, but at times it must be done.
Item_Mushroom_B_PictureBook: Often found at the base of pine trees in cold climates, these mushrooms are cool to the touch and can be used to cook dishes that allow you to stay cool even in arid regions.
Item_ChilledFish_03_Desc: Being frozen has condensed the taste of fish inside this trout's body. Eating it will provide a temporary boost to your heat resistance.
Item_Enemy_08_Desc: This prized ingredient can be obtained from Moblins. Its odor is too pungent for normal food preparation, but stew it with some critters to make elixirs.
Item_Roast_18_Desc: A roasted hearty radish. Fragrant and warm, it has no special effect but will restore hearts.
Obj_DLC_HeroSoul_Rito_Desc: Champion Revali's divine gift. Creates an upward draft that carries you into the sky. Activate by charging your jump with . It now requires less time to recharge.
Obj_FireArrow_A_03_Desc: A bundle of five fire arrows. Fire arrows break apart on impact, igniting objects in the immediate area. Incredibly effective against cold things.
Item_Mushroom_E_Desc: A common mushroom found near trees around Hyrule. Eat it to restore half a heart.
Item_Roast_04_Desc: This toasted stamella shroom doesn't grant any special effects, but it will restore a bit of health.
Item_Roast_33_Desc: It's not very shocking that this fully roasted zapshroom is delicious. Eat it to recover a bit of health.
Item_RoastFish_11_Desc: The shell of this hearty blueshell snail acted as a tiny slow cooker as it was roasted. Some people love the trademark bitterness of its tail meat.
Item_PlantGet_G_Desc: This medicinal plant is known for its sharp thorns and for the fruit it bears. The fruit contains a compound that increases attack power when cooked into a dish.
Obj_DLC_HeroSoul_Goron_Desc: Champion Daruk's divine gift. So long as you're holding , it will automatically protect you from all manner of attacks. It now requires less time to recharge.
PutRupee_Blue_Desc: Five rupees. Its shiny blue facets make you weak in the knees.
Item_FishGet_J_PictureBook: This red trout prefers warm bodies of water. It has a special organ specifically for storing heat. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily boosts your resistance to the cold.
Item_RoastFish_09_Desc: The soft and fluffy texture of this seafaring fish has been enhanced by roasting it over an open fire. The crisp, aromatic skin is particularly delicious.
Item_FishGet_I_PictureBook: This fish makes its home in cold water, giving it extra layers of fat. It temporarily increases your maximum hearts when used in cooking.
Item_InsectGet_O_PictureBook: This crab's shell is particularly hard. When cooked into a dish, its fat and meat bolster the body to increase your defense.
Item_Ore_I_Desc: Strike it with a metallic weapon to generate a spark. This portable fire starter breaks after one use, but it can create a long-lasting flame if you use it near firewood.
Item_Chilled_03_Desc: This raw gourmet meat has been frozen for easy traveling. It's kept its flavor through the freezing process. Eating it as is will provide a temporary boost to your heat resistance.
Item_Fruit_D_Desc: This fruit's mighty odor has earned it the nickname "king of fruits." It offers immense restorative powers; dishes cooked with it will temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_FishGet_D_Desc: This trout makes its home in the freshwater lakes. Its scales have an insulating compound that, when cooked into a dish, offers resistance to electricity.
Item_Material_01_Desc: When boiled with other ingredients, the cane breaks down into a sweet juice necessary for making cakes and other sweets. It's commonly found in ingredients stores.
Obj_HeroSoul_Goron_Desc: A protective power containing the perfect defense of the Champion Daruk. It will automatically protect you from all manner of attacks as long as you're holding .
Item_Fruit_J_PictureBook: An extremely tough pumpkin raised in village fields. When cooked, that toughness manifests itself by considerably upping defense.
Item_Roast_16_Desc: Flame-roasted fleet-lotus seeds. Peel the skin back to get to the soft and flaky center.
Item_Enemy_19_Desc: A rare material dropped by a defeated Keese. It's fun to look at, but it doesn't seem to have much use at first glance. But it must be good for something...
Item_Enemy_48_Desc: This shard chipped and fell off the red spirit Dinraal. Its horn is said to be the crystallized power of fire itself. It sells for a high price, but rumors say there's some other use for it.
Item_Mushroom_C_Desc: A bright red mushroom that grows in hot climates. Imbued with the power of heat,  they can be used to cook dishes that will allow you endure the bitter cold.
Item_Enemy_05_Desc: The severed tail of a Lizalfos. It continues to wriggle even after being separated from its body. That kind of vitality makes it highly valued as an ingredient in elixirs.
Item_Enemy_34_Desc: A giant, smelly Hinox organ of unknown function. Upon close inspection, it appears to be quivering. It can be used to make an elixir, but some say it has other uses, as well.
Item_Mushroom_O_Desc: A rare yellowish-orange mushroom. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your stamina limit.
Obj_DLC_HeroSoul_Gerudo_Desc: Champion Urbosa's divine gift. Summons powerful lightning to the surrounding area. Trigger with a charge attack by holding . It now requires less time to recharge.
Obj_Photo_BossEnemy_Desc: A picture of a powerful monster that at one time stood in your way.
Item_Roast_01_Desc: Raw meat cooked over an open flame. Cooking it has increased its flavor and the number of hearts it provides.
Item_FishGet_D_PictureBook: This trout makes its home in the freshwater lakes. Its scales have an insulating compound that, when cooked into a dish, offers resistance to electricity.
Obj_DungeonClearSeal_Desc: A symbol of courage given to those who have overcome the challenges of a shrine.
Item_Mushroom_F_00_Desc: This rare mushroom has a rich scent. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_Fruit_E_00_Desc: The plant that bears these seeds grows near deep water. The roots draw nutrients from the water, which boosts your movement speed when the seeds are cooked into a dish.
Item_FishGet_C_PictureBook: This blue trout prefers cold bodies of water. Its skin contains enzymes that keep its body cool, and when cooked into a dish, it will temporarily boost your heat resistance.
Item_Meat_01_Desc: Meat obtained from animals in plains and forests. You can eat it raw, but cooking it will make it more delicious and nutritious.
Obj_DLC_HeroSeal_Zora_Desc: The commemorative symbol of a water trial's completion by one who wishes to control a Divine Beast. Collecting three emblems will lead to a new challenge.
Item_Fruit_A_Desc: A common fruit found on trees all around Hyrule. Eat it fresh, or cook it to increase its effect.
Item_FishGet_A_Desc: An ordinary fish that can be found all over Hyrule. It can be eaten raw, but cooking it amplifies its healing benefits.
Item_Enemy_17_Desc: A jiggly substance that came from an Ice Chuchu. It's cool to the touch, and squeezing it seems to relieve stress. If struck, it will explode in a cold mist.
Obj_HeroSoul_Zora_Desc: A restorative power born from the spirit of the Champion Mipha. When your hearts run out, you'll automatically be resurrected with full  health plus temporary bonus hearts.
Item_Roast_27_Desc: Lightly toasted mighty thistle. It has no special effects, but now that it's been grilled, the pointy ends go down smooth.
Item_Fruit_D_PictureBook: This fruit's mighty odor has earned it the nickname "king of fruits." It offers immense restorative powers; dishes cooked with it will temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_FishGet_M_Desc: This large, glow-in-the-dark snail lives in fresh water. When cooked into a dish, it heightens your senses so you can move about silently.
Item_Roast_13_Desc: A pepper that's been gently caressed by an open flame. It's much less spicy now.
Item_Fruit_C_PictureBook: Cacti found in the Gerudo Desert bear this sweet fruit. It's naturally insulated, so when cooked into a dish, it provides resistance against electricity.
Item_Enemy_45_Desc: A rare Electric Keese wing. The part of the Electric Keese that produces electricity is not in its wings, so it won't shock you. Toss it in with some critters to make elixirs.
Obj_IceArrow_A_02_PictureBook: A bundle of 10 ice arrows. Ice arrows break apart on impact, freezing objects in the immediate area. Incredibly effective against hot things.
Item_PlantGet_B_Desc: A rare radish that grows best in sunny plains. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_Enemy_02_Desc: A rare material obtained by defeating a Bokoblin. It convulses on its own every now and then, which is really creepy, but perhaps it has a use.
Item_Enemy_31_Desc: A giant energy crystal made using lost ancient technology. Cores this large are an extremely rare find. A researcher would probably know how to use this.
Item_Mushroom_L_Desc: This mushroom is known for the natural slice in its cap. Eating it fosters your competitive spirit. Use it when cooking to prepare a dish that will increase your strength.
Item_ChilledFish_09_Desc: It takes a skilled chef to get the meat out of this frozen hearty blueshell snail. Eating this will provide a temporary increase to your heat resistance.
Item_PlantGet_M_PictureBook: This carrot is cultivated extensively in Kakariko Village. It strengthens the legs and hips when cooked into a dish, which helps increase your movement speed.
Item_FishGet_X_PictureBook: Consuming the bioluminescent compound that makes this fish glow in the dark will increase concentration. Dishes cooked with it will suppress noise when consumed.
Item_Ore_D_Desc: This precious yellow gem contains the power of electricity. It's been known to fetch a high price since ancient times.
Item_PlantGet_L_PictureBook: This medicinal plant grows abundantly in the Gerudo Desert. Its peculiar fibers conduct electricity, which will increase your electricity resistance when cooked into a dish.
Item_Roast_39_Desc: A whole, toasted silent shroom. High heat may have destroyed its soft glow, but it's now fragrant and tasty.
Item_Meat_12_Desc: This prized meat can be obtained from certain birds. It gets full points for flavor, nutrition, and volume. It pairs perfectly with other ingredients or can be enjoyed alone.
Obj_IceArrow_A_02_Desc: A bundle of 10 ice arrows. Ice arrows break apart on impact, freezing objects in the immediate area. Incredibly effective against hot things.
Item_RoastFish_03_Desc: This trout can be found all over Hyrule. Served river-to-table, it's simply cooked for a soft and flaky flesh with a mild flavor.
Item_Enemy_57_Desc: This inflatable Octorok organ has a lot of lift, so attach it to items you want to see float. Hold it in your hands, and then place it on an object to attach it.
Item_Enemy_28_Desc: A spring used in ancient machinery. It is light and buoyant enough to float on water, and no matter how many times it's compressed, it never loses tension.
Obj_BombArrow_A_03_Desc: A bundle of 10 bomb arrows. The explosive powder packed into the tips of these arrows ignites on impact, dealing big damage to anything caught in the blast.
Item_Mushroom_L_PictureBook: This mushroom is known for the natural slice in its cap. Eating it fosters your competitive spirit. Use it when cooking to prepare a dish that will increase your strength.
Item_Enemy_14_Desc: This highly sought-after ingredient can only be obtained from a Lynel. It pulses with the vitality of a Lynel, a strength that makes it invaluable as an ingredient for elixirs.
Obj_ElectricArrow_A_03_PictureBook: A bundle of five shock arrows. Shock arrows break apart on impact, channeling electricity into nearby objects. Very effective against metals and moisture.
Obj_FireWoodBundle_Desc: A portable bundle of wood. You can use this to make a campfire if you have something to light it.
Item_Roast_53_Desc: A toasted endura shroom. It doesn't grant any special effects, but boy is it tasty!
Item_FishGet_J_Desc: This red trout prefers warm bodies of water. It has a special organ specifically for storing heat. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily boosts your resistance to the cold.
Item_Fruit_J_Desc: An extremely tough pumpkin raised in village fields. When cooked, that toughness manifests itself by considerably upping defense.
Obj_ElectricArrow_A_02_PictureBook: A bundle of 10 shock arrows. Shock arrows break apart on impact, channeling electricity into nearby objects. Very effective against metals and moisture.
Item_Mushroom_J_PictureBook: A strange mushroom that glows softly in the forest at night. Cooking it into a dish unlocks the nutrients in its cap, resulting in a meal that will allow you to move stealthily.
Item_ChilledFish_07_Desc: Doesn't provide as much companionship as an unfrozen crab, but it won't spoil during your travels. Eat it to gain a temporary boost to your heat resistance.
Item_Roast_10_Desc: This palm fruit was broiled with direct heat, resulting in steamed flesh inside the rind. Best served at the moment the juices emerge while roasting.
PutRupee_Desc: A single rupee. Its soft green glow puts a smile on your face.
Get_TwnObj_DLC_MemorialPicture_A_01_Desc: A picture of Zelda and the five Champions, taken after the inauguration ceremony at Hyrule Castle. Kass gifted you this precious item after completing The Champions' Ballad.
Obj_Maracas_Desc: Hestu's beloved maracas. He's been shaking them since he was two years old.
Item_Roast_08_Desc: This voltfruit from the Gerudo Desert has been charred to really bring out its sweet and sour flavors.
Item_RoastFish_15_Desc: A whole crab slow-roasted in its shell. The soft, flaky flesh pairs nicely with the scent of the charred shell for a meal that assaults all five of your senses in all the best ways.
Item_FishGet_L_00_Desc: This Hyrule bass got to be the biggest fish by never getting caught (until now). Its long life results in a cooked dish that will restore a lot of stamina.
Item_PlantGet_G_PictureBook: This medicinal plant is known for its sharp thorns and for the fruit it bears. The fruit contains a compound that increases attack power when cooked into a dish.
Item_Ore_A_Desc: The most precious gem one can find in Hyrule, its signature sparkle has charmed Hyruleans for generations. As such, it has sold for a very high price since ancient times.
Item_PlantGet_F_PictureBook: This medicinal plant grows in hot regions, such as the Gerudo Desert. It's warm to the touch and increases your cold resistance when cooked into a dish.
Item_Enemy_26_Desc: A gear used in ancient machinery. Despite being incredibly old, its build quality is leaps and bounds above anything built using current technology.
Obj_ProofGiantKiller_Desc: A medal presented by Kilton in somber honor of having defeated every Hinox. Ending a monster's life is never an easy task, but at times it is a necessary one.
Item_Roast_36_Desc: A rushroom that's been put to the torch. It may have lost its speedy properties, but at least it tastes good now.
Item_Enemy_54_Desc: This claw was plucked from the golden spirit Farosh. Its electricity was expelled before it was removed, so it's safe to handle. A store will buy it, but it must have some other use.
Item_Material_05_Desc: This fresh milk comes from Hateno cows and white goats kept in the village. It's delicious on its own but can also be used as an ingredient in soups and stews.
Item_Enemy_40_Desc: A gelatinous substance that came from a Chuchu. It's unusable in this state, but applying a bit of elemental stimulation will change its form.
Item_Meat_07_Desc: A high-quality piece of meat that's hard to come by. You can eat it raw, but cooking it first will recover more hearts.
Item_Mushroom_E_PictureBook: A common mushroom found near trees around Hyrule. Eat it to restore half a heart.
Item_Roast_50_Desc: This flame-kissed endura carrot makes for a truly extravagant single-item dish. The fire really brought out its sweetness.
PutRupee_Purple_Desc: 50 rupees. Its violet glow fills your heart with generosity.
Obj_ProofKorok_Desc: A gift of friendship given to you by Hestu. It smells pretty bad.
Item_ChilledFish_04_Desc: The crunchy, icy texture of this chilled carp is quite the delicacy. Eating it will temporarily increase your heat resistance.
Item_Roast_19_Desc: A roasted big hearty radish. To take such a precious vegetable and put it to the fire is decadent in a way.
Item_Roast_48_Desc: An acorn cooked with direct heat. Its nutty aroma has been amplified.
Obj_Photo_Material_Desc: A picture of a cooking ingredient, such as an apple or a mushroom.
Item_Mushroom_F_Desc: This rare mushroom has a rich scent. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
Item_Roast_05_Desc: A hearty truffle with a toasted, crispy outside and a warm, gooey inside.
Item_FishGet_M_PictureBook: This large, glow-in-the-dark snail lives in fresh water. When cooked into a dish, it heightens your senses so you can move about silently.
Item_PlantGet_H_Desc: This tough medicinal plant cannot be broken, but it can be cooked. Its durable yet flexible fibers raise your defense when cooked into a dish.
Item_FishGet_L_PictureBook: This Hyrule bass got to be the biggest fish by never getting caught (until now). Its long life results in a cooked dish that will restore a lot of stamina.
Item_FishGet_K_PictureBook: This snail lives on sandy beaches in large numbers. Its flesh contains a high amount of stimulants, so when cooked into a dish, it temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
Item_Ore_J_Desc: A mysterious stone fragment that fell from the sky. It looks like it would fetch a good price, but you may be able to use it in certain recipes as well.
Item_Chilled_04_Desc: It's as hard as a rock but is supposedly edible. It restores a small number of hearts and has a cooling effect.
Item_Fruit_E_Desc: The plant that bears these seeds grows near deep water. The roots draw nutrients from the water, which boosts your movement speed when the seeds are cooked into a dish.
Item_FishGet_E_Desc: This freshwater fish lives alongside its less mighty carp ilk. A compound in its liver promotes muscle growth. Dishes cooked with it will temporarily increase your attack power.
Item_Enemy_51_Desc: This shard fell from the blue spirit Naydra's fang. It's much harder than any metal, so it's impossible to process. Yet rumors say it can be used as a material for something.
Item_Material_02_Desc: Made from several types of spices, this secret Goron seasoning has been handed down for generations. An initial wave of spiciness paves the way for the sweetness.
Obj_ElectricArrow_A_02_Desc: A bundle of 10 shock arrows. Shock arrows break apart on impact, channeling electricity into nearby objects. Very effective against metals and moisture.
Item_Enemy_49_Desc: This precious scale fell from the blue spirit Naydra. It contains a bitter cold within. You can use it in cooking, but just eating it seems like a waste.
Obj_FireArrow_A_02_Desc: A bundle of 10 fire arrows. Fire arrows break apart on impact, igniting objects in the immediate area. Incredibly effective against cold things.
Item_ChilledFish_01_Desc: That's one cold fish. Eating it won't restore many hearts, but it will lower your body temperature a bit.
Item_Enemy_06_Desc: This splendid horn once grew atop the head of a Moblin. It can't be used in normal food recipes, but it does have some use as an ingredient in making elixirs.
Item_Roast_45_Desc: The highest quality raw gourmet meat, just kissed by an open flame. No additional seasonings have been added, which lets the natural flavor of the meat really shine.
Armor_124_Head_Desc: A traditional Gerudo headpiece. It's set with a ruby, which uses the power of fire to make the cold more bearable. A Great Fairy increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_064_Head_Desc: Zora headgear made from dragon scales. Increases swimming speed and allows you to spin to attack underwater. A Great Fairy has increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_085_Head_Desc: This bandanna uses ancient technology that enhances core strength to improve your climbing ability. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by three levels.
Armor_024_Head_Desc: A luxurious headpiece sold at Gerudo jewelry shops. It's decorated with a diamond, which harnesses the power of light to reduce damage received from ancient enemies.
Armor_045_Head_Desc: Kilton's handmade Moblin headgear. It's designed to replicate the Moblin's distinct long nose and large horn. Equip it to blend in with Moblins.
Armor_230_Head_Desc: According to legend, this cap was once treasured by an ancient hero. It's quite the simple cap, yet there's something about it that's just so appealing...
Armor_228_Head_Desc: A mask worn by a hero from a world in which the moon was falling, legends say. Wearing it provides godlike power. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by three levels.
Armor_005_Head_Desc: According to legend, this cap was crafted for a hero who travels the wild lands. Wearing it just feels so right.
Armor_191_Head_Desc: A treasure gifted to the one who controls Divine Beast Vah Medoh. It endows its user with enhanced abilities. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by two levels.
Armor_211_Head_Desc: According to legend, this cap was once worn by a hero who battled the monsters of twilight. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by one level.
Armor_189_Head_Desc: A treasure gifted to the one who controls Divine Beast Vah Ruta. It endows its user with enhanced abilities. A Great Fairy has increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_111_Head_Desc: A helmet once worn by the warriors of an ancient warlike tribe from the Faron region. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by one level.
Armor_209_Head_Desc: According to legend, this cap was treasured by a hero who traveled the Great Sea. A Great Fairy has increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_172_Head_Desc: An eerie mask passed down from ancient times. Wearing it makes it harder for certain enemies to spot you. It's a rather rare find.
Armor_072_Head_Desc: A Rito accessory made from snow-bird feathers. Adorned with a ruby, a gem that harnesses the power of fire. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by three levels.
Armor_132_Head_Desc: Earrings made with topaz, which harnesses the power of lightning to increase electricity resistance. A Great Fairy has increased their defense to its maximum level.
Armor_053_Head_Desc: A mask worn by Gerudo women. It protects the skin from the harsh sun, but don't expect it to protect much in combat...
Armor_176_Head_Desc: A mask inspired by those fun-loving Koroks. It shakes when one is hiding nearby. It's a rather rare find.
Armor_197_Head_Desc: A treasure gifted to the one who controls Divine Beast Vah Rudania. It endows its user with enhanced abilities. A Great Fairy has increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_097_Head_Desc: Sturdy headgear for protecting frontline soldiers from vicious monsters. Praised for its superior defense. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by three levels.
Armor_217_Head_Desc: According to legend, this cap was once worn by a hero who appeared from the sky riding a mighty bird. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by two levels.
Armor_117_Head_Desc: A headpiece set with a diamond, which uses the power of light to reduce damage from ancient enemies. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by one level.
Armor_138_Head_Desc: Earrings made with amber, a gem that harnesses the power of the land to increase your defense. A Great Fairy has increased their defense by two levels.
Armor_040_Head_Desc: Gerudo armor for males. Contains sapphire, which harnesses the power of ice to make the heat more bearable. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by one level.
Armor_078_Head_Desc: A Sheikah-made mask that suppresses the noisy rustling of clothes. Perfect for sneaking about. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by three levels.
Armor_100_Head_Desc: Headgear that uses Guardian parts to decrease the damage from ancient energy attacks. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by two levels.
Armor_223_Head_Desc: A mask said to have been worn by a Sheikah who saved a time-traveling hero. Ideal for undercover work. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by three levels.
Armor_184_Head_Desc: A treasure gifted to the one who controls Divine Beast Vah Naboris. It endows its user with enhanced abilities.
Armor_204_Head_Desc: According to legend, this cap was once worn by a hero who traveled through time. A Great Fairy has increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_104_Head_Desc: An electricity-resistant helmet made from an ancient material called "rubber." A Great Fairy has increased its defense by two levels.
Armor_125_Head_Desc: A Gerudo headpiece set with a sapphire, which harnesses the power of ice to make the heat more bearable. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by one level.
Armor_065_Head_Desc: Gerudo armor for males. Contains sapphire, which harnesses the power of ice to make the heat more bearable. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by two levels.
Armor_025_Head_Desc: A headpiece made by Gerudo craft workers. It's set with a ruby, a gem that harnesses the power of fire to make cold climates more bearable.
Armor_086_Head_Desc: This bandanna uses ancient technology that enhances core strength to improve your climbing ability. A Great Fairy increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_046_Head_Desc: A helmet made from ancient techniques and electricity-resistant material. It's made from something called "rubber," a material that can no longer be found.
Armor_231_Head_Desc: According to legend, this cap was once treasured by an ancient hero. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by one level.
Armor_006_Head_Desc: Zora headgear made from dragon scales. Increases swimming speed and allows you to spin to attack underwater.
Armor_229_Head_Desc: A mask worn by a hero from a world in which the moon was falling, legends say. Wearing it provides godlike power. A Great Fairy increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_192_Head_Desc: A treasure gifted to the one who controls Divine Beast Vah Medoh. It endows its user with enhanced abilities. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by three levels.
Armor_212_Head_Desc: According to legend, this cap was once worn by a hero who battled the monsters of twilight. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by two levels.
Armor_112_Head_Desc: A helmet once worn by the warriors of an ancient warlike tribe from the Faron region. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by two levels.
Armor_073_Head_Desc: A Rito accessory made from snow-bird feathers. Adorned with a ruby, a gem that harnesses the power of fire. A Great Fairy increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_133_Head_Desc: Earrings containing opal, a gem that harnesses the power of water to increase your swimming speed. A Great Fairy has increased their defense by one level.
Armor_014_Head_Desc: It may look like a regular bandanna, but it's actually infused with ancient technology that enhances core strength to improve your climbing ability.
Armor_177_Head_Desc: The hood of a traveling merchant who had a bracelet that could turn the wearer into a painting. Wearing it increases your sideways climbing speed. It's a rather rare find.
Armor_160_Head_Desc: This headgear is the product of Kilton's monster research. He crafted it with a monster born from the shadows in mind. The eyes glow an eerie red in the dark.
Armor_198_Head_Desc: A treasure gifted to the one who controls Divine Beast Vah Naboris. It endows its user with enhanced abilities. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by one level.
Armor_098_Head_Desc: Sturdy headgear for protecting frontline soldiers from vicious monsters. Praised for its superior defense. A Great Fairy has increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_120_Head_Desc: A headpiece set with a diamond, which uses the power of light to reduce damage from ancient enemies. A Great Fairy increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_218_Head_Desc: According to legend, this cap was once worn by a hero who appeared from the sky riding a mighty bird. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by three levels.
Armor_060_Head_Desc: According to legend, this cap was crafted for a hero who travels the wild lands. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by three levels.
Armor_020_Head_Desc: Headgear made from sturdy metals for frontline soldiers. Praised for their defensive capabilities, the only helms that remain are those that survived the Calamity.
Armor_118_Head_Desc: A headpiece set with a diamond, which uses the power of light to reduce damage from ancient enemies. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by two levels.
Armor_139_Head_Desc: Earrings made with amber, a gem that harnesses the power of the land to increase your defense. A Great Fairy has increased their defense by three levels.
Armor_079_Head_Desc: A Sheikah-made mask that suppresses the noisy rustling of clothes. Perfect for sneaking about. A Great Fairy has increased its defense to its maximum level.
Armor_101_Head_Desc: Headgear that uses Guardian parts to decrease the damage from ancient energy attacks. A Great Fairy has increased its defense by three levels.
Armor_001_Head_Desc: A hood woven using traditional Hyrulean  methods. It's made from a sturdy material to protect travelers from the harsh sun and weather.

IceArrow_PictureBook: An arrow imbued with the power of ice. It breaks apart on impact, freezing objects in the immediate area. It's incredibly effective against hot things.
BombArrow_A_PictureBook: A powerful arrow designed to destroy monsters. The explosive powder packed into the tip ignites on impact, dealing massive damage to anything caught in the blast.
AncientArrow_Desc: An arrow created using ancient technology. To be struck with one is to be consigned to oblivion in an instant. It deals devastating damage—even against Guardians.
FireArrow_PictureBook: An arrow imbued with the power of fire. It breaks apart on impact, igniting objects in the immediate area. It's incredibly effective against cold things.

NormalArrow_PictureBook: A common arrow. Its shaft was carved from the wood of a sturdy tree.

Animal_Insect_N_PictureBook: The powdery scales of this butterfly's wings cool the air around it. Watching it flutter around snowflakes is a thing of beauty. Cook it with monster parts for a heat-resistant elixir.
