Weapon_Lsword_029_PictureBook: Only the most talented Gerudo sword fighters carry this two-handed sword. It's actually much lighter than it appears and is surprisingly easy to wield.
Weapon_Lsword_041_Desc: A single-edged sword seldom seen in Hyrule. This weapon is passed down through the Sheikah tribe and has an astonishingly sharp edge ideal for slicing.
Weapon_Lsword_019_Desc: A Moblin bone that continues to move even after being detached from its body. The bone is thick enough to be used as a weapon but is extremely brittle and easily broken.
Weapon_Lsword_002_PictureBook: A two-handed sword designed for combat. It's heavy and hard to use but has decent build quality and durability.
Weapon_Lsword_024_Desc: A two-handed sword issued to the Hyrulean royal family's immediate guard detail. Its powerful strikes are said to crush an opponent's body and resolve alike.
Weapon_Lsword_010_PictureBook: A crudely fashioned club favored by Moblins. It's carved from a sturdy tree but is sloppily made, so it breaks easily.
Weapon_Lsword_012_Desc: The bone of an ancient beast has been affixed to this Moblin club, further increasing its damage. Moblins carrying these in battle are particularly dangerous.
Weapon_Lsword_055_Desc: A curious double-edged sword crafted using Sheikah technology. It was originally made for Hyrulean knights unfamiliar with single- edged blades.
Weapon_Lsword_038_Desc: Made for paddling boats, but it was made sturdy enough to fight strong currents. Maybe it's useful for self-defense in a pinch.
Weapon_Lsword_060_Desc: A peculiar greatsword allegedly used by a hero from a world in which the moon threatened to fall. It slashes wildly in battle as if possessed by a fierce deity.
Weapon_Lsword_031_Desc: This large iron sledgehammer was originally used for mining, but it works reasonably well as a weapon too.
Weapon_Lsword_041_PictureBook: A single-edged sword seldom seen in Hyrule. This weapon is passed down through the Sheikah tribe and has an astonishingly sharp edge ideal for slicing.
Weapon_Lsword_033_PictureBook: This magic-infused greatsword was forged in the fires of Death Mountain by Goron smiths in an ancient age. Attack when the blade glows red to expel flames.
Weapon_Lsword_017_PictureBook: This Lynel-made two-handed weapon has been reinforced to increase its durability and striking power. Its overwhelming heft will crush your foe, shield and all.
Weapon_Lsword_074_Desc: This sword is favored by high-ranking members of the Yiga. When wielded by a proficient fighter, its unique shape cleaves the very wind and creates a vacuum.

Weapon_Lsword_057_Desc: The Six Sages are said to have forged this longsword to seal a demon king in the world where the hero fought against the beasts of twilight. The blade shines with a holy luster.
Weapon_Lsword_005_PictureBook: After much consideration by Bokoblins on how to improve the Boko bat, they simply attached sharp spikes to it. A skilled fighter can cause immense damage with this.
Weapon_Lsword_056_PictureBook: A single swing of this giant, sturdy leaf can create a gust of wind strong enough to blow away light objects. These will sometimes fall off trees as they're chopped down.
Weapon_Lsword_002_Desc: A two-handed sword designed for combat. It's heavy and hard to use but has decent build quality and durability.
Weapon_Shield_006_Desc: This Boko shield is reinforced with fossilized bone. Its defensive capabilities are respectable, but its predictably slipshod craftsmanship spells low durability.
Weapon_Shield_037_Desc: This shield was cherished by the Gerudo Champion Urbosa. The gold used to make it was handpicked to ensure a design that is both lightweight and very durable.
Weapon_Shield_016_Desc: A sturdy shield favored by Lynels for its defensive and offensive capabilities. First and foremost a shield, but the bladed edges can deal slashing attacks when deflecting.
Weapon_Shield_026_Desc: The design of this metal shield has changed over time to match the Gerudo's sword-and- shield fighting style. It's favored by soldiers and travelers alike.
Weapon_Shield_057_Desc: A shield said to have been the favorite of a hero who traveled the open seas. It was apparently a family heirloom, passed down through many generations.
Weapon_Shield_002_Desc: A shield once used by the guards of Hyrule Castle. It's easy to handle, but its core is  made of wood, so it can catch fire.
Weapon_Shield_009_Desc: This Lizal shield is adorned with several metal shells as a means of reinforcement. Its defensive capabilities are high, but its weight requires a skilled soldier to bear.
Weapon_Shield_022_Desc: A shield issued to the Hyrulean royal family's immediate guard detail. It boasts a high defense, but these days it's more a collector's item due to its ornamentation.
Weapon_Shield_032_Desc: Often carried by fishermen for its fish design, which represents hope for a great catch. Its light wooden construction makes it convenient to take onto a boat.
Weapon_Shield_042_Desc: Rito warriors cherish this shield. Its unique shape is designed with mid-battle flight in mind to facilitate aerial combat.
Weapon_Shield_005_Desc: A Boko shield made of slightly stronger wood and reinforced with animal bones.
Weapon_Shield_036_Desc: This extravagant shield is presented to Gerudo warriors who rise to the rank of captain. Its apparent opulence is rivaled only by its combat capabilities.
Weapon_Shield_015_Desc: The output level of this shield has been boosted to maximum. Its combat capabilities surpass those of metallic shields, and it can deflect Guardian Scout beams.
Weapon_Shield_025_Desc: A Zora-made shield adorned with intricate ornamentation. It's said that true masters of this shield can redirect attacks as a rock redirects rushing water.
Weapon_Shield_001_Desc: This lightweight, simple shield is ideal for less-experienced fighters. It can withstand light attacks, but blocking stronger blows is not recommended.
Weapon_Shield_037_PictureBook: This shield was cherished by the Gerudo Champion Urbosa. The gold used to make it was handpicked to ensure a design that is both lightweight and very durable.
Weapon_Shield_008_Desc: This Lizal shield has been strengthened by adding a different type of metal to the mix. The edge is lined with spikes, so handle with care.
Weapon_Shield_018_PictureBook: This ultimate Lynel shield is used only by the white-haired Lynels. It excels at defending against even the most brutal of attacks and cutting down powerful foes when deflecting.
Weapon_Shield_018_Desc: This ultimate Lynel shield is used only by the white-haired Lynels. It excels at defending against even the most brutal of attacks and cutting down powerful foes when deflecting.
Weapon_Shield_038_PictureBook: This shield was made using ancient Sheikah technology. Its surface glows blue when raised in defense. Enhanced functionality allows it to deflect Guardian beams.
Weapon_Shield_021_Desc: It's likely this rusty old shield once belonged to a knight. It still has some defensive capabilities, but its usefulness has been worn down by time.
Weapon_Shield_008_PictureBook: This Lizal shield has been strengthened by adding a different type of metal to the mix. The edge is lined with spikes, so handle with care.
Weapon_Shield_031_Desc: Favored by hunters for its rabbit design, which is said to bring luck on hunts. It's easy to use, but its durability leaves something to be desired.
Weapon_Shield_035_PictureBook: A sturdy shield loved by many an adventurer. It is made of animal hide and sturdy wood and is best suited to defending against weak monsters or animals.
Weapon_Shield_016_PictureBook: A sturdy shield favored by Lynels for its defensive and offensive capabilities. First and foremost a shield, but the bladed edges can deal slashing attacks when deflecting.
Weapon_Shield_041_Desc: A small Sheikah-made shield. Its design is intended to decrease blind spots without sacrificing too much defense.
Weapon_Shield_004_Desc: A Bokoblin-made shield created by attaching a handhold to any flat tree bark picked up off the ground. It's pretty shoddy, so don't expect it to last very long.
Weapon_Shield_009_PictureBook: This Lizal shield is adorned with several metal shells as a means of reinforcement. Its defensive capabilities are high, but its weight requires a skilled soldier to bear.
Weapon_Shield_036_PictureBook: This extravagant shield is presented to Gerudo warriors who rise to the rank of captain. Its apparent opulence is rivaled only by its combat capabilities.
Weapon_Shield_017_PictureBook: This Lynel-made shield has been reinforced with armor and even more blades. Stronger in both defense and offense, it can tear through basic armor when deflecting.
Weapon_Shield_035_Desc: A sturdy shield loved by many an adventurer. It is made of animal hide and sturdy wood and is best suited to defending against weak monsters or animals.
Weapon_Shield_025_PictureBook: A Zora-made shield adorned with intricate ornamentation. It's said that true masters of this shield can redirect attacks as a rock redirects rushing water.
Weapon_Shield_006_PictureBook: This Boko shield is reinforced with fossilized bone. Its defensive capabilities are respectable, but its predictably slipshod craftsmanship spells low durability.
Weapon_Shield_014_Desc: This larger version of a Guardian shield has had its output level boosted. Its defensive capabilities are comparable to those of a metal shield's.
Weapon_Shield_014_PictureBook: This larger version of a Guardian shield has had its output level boosted. Its defensive capabilities are comparable to those of a metal shield's.
Weapon_Shield_026_PictureBook: The design of this metal shield has changed over time to match the Gerudo's sword-and- shield fighting style. It's favored by soldiers and travelers alike.
Weapon_Shield_007_PictureBook: A common shield found among the Lizalfos. It's made of metal, but its sloppy craftsmanship offers poor durability.
Weapon_Shield_034_Desc: This shield features a traditional design from Necluda. Its combat capabilities aren't much better than the standard wooden shield, but it found popularity for its design.
Weapon_Shield_034_PictureBook: This shield features a traditional design from Necluda. Its combat capabilities aren't much better than the standard wooden shield, but it found popularity for its design.
Weapon_Shield_015_PictureBook: The output level of this shield has been boosted to maximum. Its combat capabilities surpass those of metallic shields, and it can deflect Guardian Scout beams.
Weapon_Shield_023_PictureBook: The Koroks made this shield specifically for Hylians. It's made from the finest hard wood of trees that grow only in the Korok forest, so it's sturdier than it looks.
Weapon_Shield_042_PictureBook: Rito warriors cherish this shield. Its unique shape is designed with mid-battle flight in mind to facilitate aerial combat.
Weapon_Shield_004_PictureBook: A Bokoblin-made shield created by attaching a handhold to any flat tree bark picked up off the ground. It's pretty shoddy, so don't expect it to last very long.
Weapon_Shield_007_Desc: A common shield found among the Lizalfos. It's made of metal, but its sloppy craftsmanship offers poor durability.
Weapon_Shield_038_Desc: This shield was made using ancient Sheikah technology. Its surface glows blue when raised in defense. Enhanced functionality allows it to deflect Guardian beams.
Weapon_Shield_005_PictureBook: A Boko shield made of slightly stronger wood and reinforced with animal bones.
Weapon_Shield_017_Desc: This Lynel-made shield has been reinforced with armor and even more blades. Stronger in both defense and offense, it can tear through basic armor when deflecting.
Weapon_Shield_032_PictureBook: Often carried by fishermen for its fish design, which represents hope for a great catch. Its light wooden construction makes it convenient to take onto a boat.
Weapon_Shield_013_PictureBook: A shield made with ancient Sheikah technology. It can deflect a Guardian Scout's beam.
Weapon_Shield_040_PictureBook: The lid of a large soup pot. It smells vaguely of poultry broth... Yum! It can take quite a beating before breaking.
Weapon_Shield_002_PictureBook: A shield once used by the guards of Hyrule Castle. It's easy to handle, but its core is  made of wood, so it can catch fire.
Weapon_Shield_021_PictureBook: It's likely this rusty old shield once belonged to a knight. It still has some defensive capabilities, but its usefulness has been worn down by time.
Weapon_Shield_030_Desc: A shield passed down through the Hyrulean royal family, along with the legend of the hero who wielded it. Its defensive capabilities and durability outshine all other shields.
Weapon_Shield_033_PictureBook: This shield was forged using ancient Sheikah technology. It boasts extremely high stopping power, but its structural weakness made its low durability impractical for combat.
Weapon_Shield_040_Desc: The lid of a large soup pot. It smells vaguely of poultry broth... Yum! It can take quite a beating before breaking.
Weapon_Shield_003_Desc: A shield favored by the knights who served the Hyrulean royal family. Its sturdy metal construction makes it quite durable, but its weight requires decent skill to wield.
Weapon_Shield_003_PictureBook: A shield favored by the knights who served the Hyrulean royal family. Its sturdy metal construction makes it quite durable, but its weight requires decent skill to wield.
Weapon_Shield_022_PictureBook: A shield issued to the Hyrulean royal family's immediate guard detail. It boasts a high defense, but these days it's more a collector's item due to its ornamentation.
Weapon_Shield_041_PictureBook: A small Sheikah-made shield. Its design is intended to decrease blind spots without sacrificing too much defense.
Weapon_Shield_030_PictureBook: A shield passed down through the Hyrulean royal family, along with the legend of the hero who wielded it. Its defensive capabilities and durability outshine all other shields.
Weapon_Shield_013_Desc: A shield made with ancient Sheikah technology. It can deflect a Guardian Scout's beam.
Weapon_Shield_031_PictureBook: Favored by hunters for its rabbit design, which is said to bring luck on hunts. It's easy to use, but its durability leaves something to be desired.
Weapon_Shield_023_Desc: The Koroks made this shield specifically for Hylians. It's made from the finest hard wood of trees that grow only in the Korok forest, so it's sturdier than it looks.
Weapon_Shield_001_PictureBook: This lightweight, simple shield is ideal for less-experienced fighters. It can withstand light attacks, but blocking stronger blows is not recommended.
Weapon_Shield_033_Desc: This shield was forged using ancient Sheikah technology. It boasts extremely high stopping power, but its structural weakness made its low durability impractical for combat.
Weapon_Sword_002_PictureBook: A sword brandished by the soldiers who once protected Hyrule Castle. Its durable blade is well tuned for slaying monsters.
Weapon_Sword_019_PictureBook: A skeletal arm that keeps moving even after it’s severed from its body. It's kind of gross to strap it to your back, but it'll do in a pinch. It's old and fragile, so it's quick to break.
Weapon_Sword_027_PictureBook: The ornamentation that adorns this blade is a traditional Zora design. It's forged from a very durable and rust-proof metal.
Weapon_Sword_009_PictureBook: More blades means more attack power! It can be used as a boomerang, but all those blades makes that a bit more dangerous. Carried by Black Lizalfos seasoned in battle.
Weapon_Sword_018_PictureBook: A brutal sword carried by white-haired Lynels. The savage blades are strong enough to cut down any foe, no matter how strong.
Weapon_Sword_052_Desc: A famous sword once beloved by the Gerudo Champion Urbosa. It is said that when Urbosa swung this sword in battle, her movements resembled a beautiful dance.
Weapon_Sword_502_PictureBook: A weapon that defeats foes with one hit and causes the user to die from one hit. It loses its sheen and power after two consecutive uses, but will eventually regain both.
Weapon_Sword_053_Desc: A grim weapon favored by the Yiga. The half- moon shape of the blade allows for the rapid delivery of fatal wounds and serves as a symbol of their terror. Its durability is low.

Weapon_Sword_059_Desc: A boomerang said to have been used by a hero who traveled the Great Sea. It smells faintly of salt water.
Weapon_Sword_030_Desc: Delicate Gerudo carvings decorate this curved sword. The engraved blade is extremely sharp. Apparently it once served ceremonial purposes in festivals.
Weapon_Sword_031_Desc: Rito craftsmen forged this lightweight, double-edged sword so Rito warriors could soar into battle unhindered by its weight.
Weapon_Sword_033_Desc: This magical sword was forged in the lava of Death Mountain. It leaves white-hot flames in its wake when the blade glows red.
Weapon_Sword_034_Desc: A magical sword forged in the frigid mountains of the Hebra region. When the blade glows blue, enemies struck by it will become frozen.
Weapon_Sword_035_Desc: A magical sword forged and refined by lightning from the Hyrule Hills. When the blade shines with a golden light, it will electrocute enemies struck by it.
Weapon_Sword_060_Desc: A magical rod that can cast fireballs, crafted by an ancient magician. The rod will break if it strikes something directly, so use it wisely.
Weapon_Sword_061_Desc: A magical rod crafted from refined ice found in the Hebra Mountains. This rod can cast waves of freezing air. Great for magic—not so great for melee.
Weapon_Sword_062_Desc: A magical rod that can shoot balls of electricity. Its gem contains lightning from the Hyrule Hills. It's not recommended to use as a melee weapon.
Weapon_Sword_062_PictureBook: A magical rod that can shoot balls of electricity. Its gem contains lightning from the Hyrule Hills. It's not recommended to use as a melee weapon.

Weapon_Sword_004_PictureBook: A crude Bokoblin club made to clobber small prey. It's essentially a stick, so its durability is low.

Weapon_Spear_022_PictureBook: A farming tool used to collect hay efficiently. It's light enough to be used by anyone. The four prongs are very sharp.
Weapon_Spear_004_PictureBook: A spear haphazardly carved from a large tree branch. It looks like its original intent was for skewering meat and cooking it, but it does have some combat merit as well.
Weapon_Spear_030_Desc: A specialized spear weighted to excel as a throwing weapon. It's perfectly balanced to be thrown farther than your average spear, able to pierce targets from a great distance.
Weapon_Spear_027_PictureBook: This spear is a Zora's weapon of choice. It's lighter than it looks due to being made from a special metal and is used by the Zora for both fishing and protecting their domain.
Weapon_Spear_004_Desc: A spear haphazardly carved from a large tree branch. It looks like its original intent was for skewering meat and cooking it, but it does have some combat merit as well.
Weapon_Spear_023_Desc: This spear is the result of countless hours of research into the ancient technology used by Guardians. The glowing spearhead has high piercing potential.
Weapon_Spear_011_PictureBook: This Moblin-made spear uses a horned animal bone as the spearhead. Like many Moblin weapons it's sloppily made, but this one packs some respectable piercing power.
Weapon_Spear_034_PictureBook: A magical spear forged from ancient ice taken from the Hebra Mountains. Attack when the blade glows blue to chill the air and freeze your foe.
Weapon_Spear_016_Desc: The crescent-shaped spearhead of this Lynel-made weapon gives it poor balance, making it difficult to wield. Lynels, however, can swing it effectively with a single hand.
Weapon_Spear_016_PictureBook: The crescent-shaped spearhead of this Lynel-made weapon gives it poor balance, making it difficult to wield. Lynels, however, can swing it effectively with a single hand.
Weapon_Spear_035_Desc: A magical spear that contains thunder from Thundra Plateau in its tip. Attack when the blade glows with a golden light to unleash an electrical attack.
Weapon_Spear_009_Desc: Skilled Lizalfos warriors tend to favor this spear. What it lacks in piercing power, it makes up for with the brutal wounds its dual ripping blades will inflict.
Weapon_Spear_023_PictureBook: This spear is the result of countless hours of research into the ancient technology used by Guardians. The glowing spearhead has high piercing potential.
Weapon_Spear_028_Desc: The most skilled Zora fighters wield this spear. Its beautiful fish-tail design belies its impressive strength; the spearhead can pierce even the toughest scales.
Weapon_Spear_009_PictureBook: Skilled Lizalfos warriors tend to favor this spear. What it lacks in piercing power, it makes up for with the brutal wounds its dual ripping blades will inflict.
Weapon_Spear_030_PictureBook: A specialized spear weighted to excel as a throwing weapon. It's perfectly balanced to be thrown farther than your average spear, able to pierce targets from a great distance.
Weapon_Spear_047_Desc: This Sheikah-made spear was created using ancient technology to combat the Calamity. Its attack power is very high, but a critical design flaw left it with poor durability.
Weapon_Spear_012_Desc: This spear is a fan favorite among Moblins. The spearhead is made from fossilized bones adorned with spikes, which greatly increases its stabbing power.
Weapon_Spear_001_Desc: A spear used mainly by travelers to fend off wolves and other beasts. It's easy to hold and simple to use.
Weapon_Spear_031_Desc: Goron artisans used recycled metal to forge this weapon. The tip is made from an old excavation bore, which affords it unmatched piercing capabilities.
Weapon_Spear_005_Desc: A Boko spear enhanced with sharpened animal bones. It's light, easy to use, and deals a decent amount of damage.
Weapon_Spear_024_Desc: This spear was issued to the knights who guarded Hyrule Castle's throne room. Its ornate design was applied by a craftsman in service to the royal family.
Weapon_Spear_050_Desc: A spear of peerless grace cherished by the Zora Champion Mipha. Although Mipha specialized in healing abilities, her spearmanship was in a class all its own.
Weapon_Spear_005_PictureBook: A Boko spear enhanced with sharpened animal bones. It's light, easy to use, and deals a decent amount of damage.
Weapon_Spear_028_PictureBook: The most skilled Zora fighters wield this spear. Its beautiful fish-tail design belies its impressive strength; the spearhead can pierce even the toughest scales.
Weapon_Spear_017_Desc: The weight and cutting edge of this Lynel- made spear have both been enhanced. It's immensely heavy for a Hylian, but a Lynel can cleave through rock with a single swing.
Weapon_Spear_036_Desc: Just a mop to the untrained eye, it excels at tidying up the place. But it owes its sturdy construction to a true craftsman, so it actually has some combat merit.
Weapon_Spear_012_PictureBook: This spear is a fan favorite among Moblins. The spearhead is made from fossilized bones adorned with spikes, which greatly increases its stabbing power.
Weapon_Spear_035_PictureBook: A magical spear that contains thunder from Thundra Plateau in its tip. Attack when the blade glows with a golden light to unleash an electrical attack.
Weapon_Spear_029_Desc: This spear's center of gravity is in its tip, making it a bit unwieldy for the average fighter. But in the hands of a skilled Gerudo warrior, it's a weapon of reliable strength.
Weapon_Spear_017_PictureBook: The weight and cutting edge of this Lynel- made spear have both been enhanced. It's immensely heavy for a Hylian, but a Lynel can cleave through rock with a single swing.
